results.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Five Takeaways From Trump’s Unruly CNN Town Hall
results.abstract: Behaving as the Republicans’ de facto nominee, Donald Trump dug in on his 2020 lies and dodged on abortion. The G.O.P. audience cheered, but so did Democrats seeking 2024 fodder.
des_facet: New York State Criminal Case Against Trump (71543-23)

media.caption: Reporters at St. Anselm College in Manchester, N.H., watched the live CNN town hall in a separate room at the event on Wednesday.

results.title: E. Jean Carroll May Sue Trump a Third Time After ‘Vile’ Comments on CNN
results.abstract: In an interview, her lawyer said that the former president’s mocking comments in a town hall broadcast could create fresh legal jeopardy.

media.caption: After reading Donald Trump’s latest comments about her, E. Jean Carroll said that she had been “insulted by better people.”

results.title: Daniel Penny Will Be Charged in Subway Chokehold Killing of Jordan Neely
results.abstract: Mr. Penny choked Mr. Neely for several minutes on the floor of an F train. He is expected to surrender on Friday and be charged with manslaughter.

media.caption: After Jordan Neely’s killing, protesters gathered in subways and on the streets calling for the arrest of Daniel Penny.

results.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff and Julie Turkewitz
results.title: What’s Driving Record Levels of Migration to the U.S. Border?
results.abstract: The United States is trying to curtail border crossings as a Covid-era immigration policy lifts this week, but it has little control over the crises in Latin America that have upended the lives of millions.

media.caption: Migrants crossing the Darién Gap in September. As many as 400,000 people are expected to make this journey in 2023, according to the United Nations.
media.copyright: Federico Rios for The New York Times

results.title: Adams Weakens Right-to-Shelter Rules, Anticipating Migrant Surge
results.abstract: Saying New York City had “reached our limit,” the Adams  administration said it would loosen regulations that have protected homeless families seeking shelter.

results.title: Trump Suggests He Knowingly Took Documents From White House

results.title: Heather Armstrong, ‘Queen of the Mommy Bloggers,’ Is Dead at 47
results.abstract: Fired from a dot-com job for making indiscreet comments about her company online, she created, under the name Dooce, a hugely popular, moneymaking blog about parenthood and marriage.

media.caption: Heather Armstrong in 2019 outside her home in Salt Lake City. She regaled her readers with accounts, as one writer wrote, of “stomach viruses and washing-machine repairs. And home design, and high-strung dogs, and reality television, and sewer-line disasters, and chiropractor visits.”
media.copyright: Daniel Dorsa for The New York Times

results.title: Supreme Court Throws Out Fraud Convictions in Albany Scandals
results.abstract: In a pair of unanimous rulings, the court sided with Joseph Percoco, a former aide to Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York, and Louis Ciminelli, a contractor in Buffalo.

media.caption: The justices considered whether Joseph Percoco could be prosecuted for conduct that took place after he resigned his government position to run Andrew M. Cuomo’s 2014 re-election campaign.
